page.title: 17PEDESTRIANISATION:RUSHDEN
page.content: Mr Ray,the director of the Technical Planning Department of the East Northants County Council told us about the pedestrianisation of Rushden High Street.This is going to take about nine years to finish.The first phase will cost about thirty thousand pounds and will be finished by Christmas.The pe- destrianisation will make the environ- ment pleasanter for the shoppers with- out worrying about being knocked over. At first shopkeepers objected to it because they thought they would lose business. The County Council are also planning to build a cycle pass connecting Grangeway and Wymington Road. This is to prevent cyclists from using the busy Manor Road and particularly help children who are cycling to Wymington Riding Stables.
